alert.note: Alert for Eastern Glacier; Eastern Pondera; Northern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 1:15PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ..Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Pondera and eastern Glacier Counties through 145 PM MDT... At 113 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms south of Browning, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Browning, South Browning, North Browning, Heart Butte and Starr School. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 213 and 249. Highway 89 between mile markers 1 and 6, and between mile markers 91 and 110. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM MDT for north central Montana.
